text: Simon Peyton Jones (1958-) born in South Africa and is a British computer scientist. He does research on (lazy) functional programming languages, such as Haskell. He works at Microsoft Research in Cambridge, England. He is married to Dorothy, a priest in the Church of England. They have six children. Simon Peyton Jones, Simon Marlow and others have developed the Glasgow Haskell Compiler, a compiler for Haskell. He has also worked on C--. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 2011. == Other websites == *Simon Peyton Jones page, Microsoft Research website ==References== Category:British computer scientists Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:White South African people Category:1958 births Category:Living people
